title: a little sister for the urw++ saa?
content:
hello.

i’m very happy that i’ve found the „saa series fd“ ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/saa/series-f-d/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071213234705/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/saa/series-f-d/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/saa/series-f-d/"))  
after many, long searches it’s exactly what i’m looking for.

but the problem now is: there are no lowercase letters available and i want to use it for copy, documents, web and much more, too. do you have an alternative in mind, which is very close on shape? i would be happy about every hint.

best regards,  
jan

comments.content:
This looks like it’s the lettering found on North American road signs. Interstate is similar, but unfortunately isn’t as extended as SAA, although it does have a ton of weights to play with.

- Lex

Gotham’s a great choice.

Avenir might be an option too:

[http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=avenir&x=0&y=0](http://web.archive.org/web/20071213234705/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=avenir&x=0&y=0 "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=avenir&x=0&y=0")
... thanks a lot! you were very helpful!
You might also want to take a look at good old reliable Trade Gothic.
